result.execSummary:
The defendant John Ernest Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any  other sentence.
*5/14/2018  amended to reflect defendant was not placed on probation.  The Court sentenced defendant to 629 days of Initial Confinement with 629 days of sentence credit, followed by two years of Extended Supervision.

superMiscConds.notes:
Cooperate with agent.
Cooperate with any coorrectional programs recommended.
Follow all rules  Extended Supervision.
Pay all supervision fees.

Obtain/maintain employment.
Obtain GED or HSED
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge.  To be collected during term of probation.  If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments.  To be collected during term of probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessment are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Defendant John Ernest Martinez in court with attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo.  Defendant John Ernest Martinez in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 629 DAYS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 629 DAYS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, concurrent with other sentence. Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions for probation and extended supervision:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain employment 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
 Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet

Attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo in court, defendant John Ernest Martinez not in court, in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting adjournment of bail hearing.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail hearing was scheduled for today in error, matter to be heard on 9/18/15 at 8:30am in br. 35.

Defendant John Ernest Martinez in court with attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo.  Defendant John Ernest Martinez in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armour. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 09-08-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court is in trial, plea hearing to be conducted by Judge McAdams, Br. 7.
